definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Foretells his own death and is faithless.
sentences.chinese: 预言自己的死亡和变心。

sentences.english: Then can you change your heart to his wife?
sentences.chinese: 对妻子也没变心啊，我也不愿离开她。

sentences.english: You turn on me ruthlessly ; with the might of your hand you attack me.
sentences.chinese: 你向我变心，待我残忍，又用大能追逼我。

sentences.english: Make it change. Learn from the Empress.
It remains consistent every day, and never changes its heart.
sentences.chinese: 它每天始终如一，永不变心。

sentences.english: Thou mayst be false, and yet I know it not.
sentences.chinese: 你可能变心，而我全然不知。

sentences.english: Tell me, have you changed your mind after these days?
sentences.chinese: 告诉我，这些日子里你是否已经变心了呢？

sentences.english: It can be consistent and never change its heart.
sentences.chinese: 它每天始终如一，永不变心。

sentences.english: In some perspective, men are coddled by their women to be unfaithful.
sentences.chinese: 从某种角度上来说男人的变心是女人给惯出来的。

sentences.english: A robot is forever -- at least until the warranty runs out.
sentences.chinese: 机器人不会变心，起码在保修期内不会。

sentences.english: The lovers promised to be faithful forever.
sentences.chinese: 这对情人互相允诺永不变心。

sentences.english: It remains consistent and never break faith.
sentences.chinese: 它每天始终如一，永不变心。

sentences.english: I cannot charge my mind to suit the crowd.
A. His new friend girlfriend, has no wonder broken faith.
sentences.chinese: 他新交了一个女朋友，难怪变心了。

sentences.english: And do you think they will have a change of heart and minds because of this tragedy?
sentences.chinese: 因此并且您是否是否认为他们将有变心和头脑悲剧？

definition: change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
to seek happiness elsewhere (euphemism for extramarital sex)/a bit on the side
fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
to part company/to split up/to break up
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
